Comments_List: Learned sooo much chinese (tough to emphasize the difference from L1), to the point where I feel like I can sort of hold my own in a conversation with a fluent speaker.
Lot of great fundamental expressions and chinese language in every skill speaking reading writing communicating.
I learned an incredible amount of Chinese this semester. I improved my listening, reading and writing skills in Chinese.
Clearer assignments. Sometimes its difficult to tell which characters will be tested.

There isnt nearly as much dialogue/small group work as Id like to see, but the class was always fun, the lecturers are, in the whole, lovely people, and want to see you succeed. However, theres a bit of an opaque grading policy, so it can be hard to know how youre doing overall.
Word to word memorization is useful but sometimes focusing more on talking would be better.

First of all, it was a an excellent course. I think the homework and the daily quizzes helped a lot with our learning. They helped me to keep the information fresh which is vital when learning a language. I also think learning the dialogues was also very helpful. I do not know any weaknesses.

Yes! Just make sure you put in the time necessary to succeedI slacked off in the first half, which meant the second half of the lessons were a mad scramble to get my grades back in shape. If you stay on top of things, though, you should be fine.

YES! This course is excellent because of the amazing teachers but be aware that you have to study daily and there are short(5 minute) quizzes and homework EVERYDAY. However, this helps to improve your Chinese immensely.
